intro: Erithalis salmeoides, commonly known as the Salminean sandthorn, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and thorny stems. The plant thrives in sandy and gravelly soils, often found in desert and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
